intro: Chaerophyllum capense, commonly known as the Cape cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces small white or greenish flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and flies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
